topic: Ruin Your Bad Habits: A Micro-Dialogue on Action

dialog.text: Why do my good intentions fizzle out after the first day?
Because your brain loves easy dopamine. If you want real change, you must make the hard path the default.
So you want me to sabotage the habit by making it harder?
Yes. Make it annoyingly hard to start, and your brain will choose the smarter path.
And how do I stick with it without quitting after a day?
Pick one target and execute. Three tiny steps: ruin the habit, ruin the perfectionist excuse, ruin self-doubt.
Can you show a quick example?
Grayscale your phone to kill endless scroll, unplug the TV after use, and post a tiny, imperfect version of your goal.
If I pick one thing today, what should I ruin first?
Ruin the biggest obstacle—make it awkward enough that you won’t bother.
I’m in. What’s the first move I can do now?
Tell me in the comments what you’ll ruin first today, and tag a friend to join. Reflection starts now.
